item.description:
NOTE: Payment required to RSVP...any RSVPs without payment will be removed. Please read instructions below about how to pay.

This is a terrific play - the first in August Wilson's Century Cycle. There are limited tickets available at this price!

Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winner August Wilson's searing drama is set in the 1920s on the south side of Chicago, where a recording session for blues legend Ma Rainey and her band becomes an intense battle of wills between a hot-headed young trumpeter and veteran musicians -- and between Ma and her white record producers. This production celebrates the Huntington Theatre Company's close relationship with the late playwright, as it has now staged all ten plays of Wilson's Century Cycle. Representing Wilson's first Broadway triumph, the show starred Charles Dutton in its original run, won the 1985 Critics' Circle Award, and was nominated for both the Tony and Drama Desk Awards that year.

Our seats will be in the balcony.  Price is $33 including all fees.  I don't want to miss out, so the RSVPs close on March 1st!  Don't delay if you want to come!

 

    PAYMENT INFO:
COST is $33 per person
Please send $33 via PayPal to me using this email: julie.chilton@yahoo.com.

IMPORTANT!  When you pay with Paypal, please click the tab that says "Personal" and where it says "This money is being sent as" click on "payment owed." 

 

Cross-posted with Gang of Gadabouts.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet up for an early dinner before the show!
item.name: Ma Rainey's Black Bottom: Explosive Drama by August Wilson
